memberdef.name: Register

detaileddescription.para: One should store the result of invoking this method in a variable, then reference that variable. If one continually invokes this, there is no guarantee that the data had not changed since the previous invocation.

briefdescription.para: If a parameter is null the JavaScript will not modify that value.

memberdef.name: ScrollIntoView

memberdef.argsstring: (KeymapArgs keymapArgs, ITextEditorEditContext editContext, TextEditorModelModifier modelModifier, TextEditorViewModelModifier viewModelModifier, CursorModifierBagTextEditor cursorModifierBag)
memberdef.name: MoveCursor

memberdef.argsstring: (KeymapArgs keymapArgs, ITextEditorEditContext editContext, TextEditorModelModifier modelModifier, TextEditorViewModelModifier viewModelModifier, CursorModifierBagTextEditor cursorModifierBag, TextEditorCursorModifier cursorModifier)
memberdef.name: MoveCursorUnsafe

briefdescription.para:
If one wants to guarantee that the state is up to date use MoveCursor instead of this method. This is because, the ITextEditorService will provide you the latest instance of the given TextEditorCursor. As opposed to whatever instance of the TextEditorCursorModifier you have at time of enqueueing.
This method is needed however, because if one wants to arbitrarily create a cursor that does not map to the view model's cursors, then one would use this method. Since an attempt to map the cursor key would come back as the cursor not existing.

memberdef.argsstring: (ITextEditorEditContext editContext, TextEditorViewModelModifier viewModelModifier, CursorModifierBagTextEditor cursorModifierBag, TextEditorCursorModifier cursorModifier)
memberdef.name: CursorMovePageTopUnsafe

briefdescription.para:
If one wants to guarantee that the state is up to date use CursorMovePageTopFactory instead of this method. This is because, the ITextEditorService will provide you the latest instance of the given TextEditorCursor. As opposed to whatever instance of the TextEditorCursorModifier you have at time of enqueueing.
This method is needed however, because if one wants to arbitrarily create a cursor that does not map to the view model's cursors, then one would use this method. Since an attempt to map the cursor key would come back as the cursor not existing.
